1472.01 PERMIT REQUIRED; DEPOSIT; INSURANCE.
   No person shall move, transport or convey any building or other similar
bulky or heavy object, including machinery, trucks and trailers, larger than
eight feet eight inches in width, across or along any street, alley or other
public way or place in the City, without first obtaining a permit therefor from
the City. Such permit shall specify the route to be used in such movement and
no person shall engage in such movement along a route other than that specified
in the permit. No such permit shall be granted until the applicant posts a cash
deposit in the amount of two hundred dollars ($200.00) and files a liability
insurance policy as required by Section
1020.03. The deposit shall be used to pay for any damage to public or private
property up to the amount thereof. Any balance shall be returned to the
applicant upon completion of the move.
1472.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
202.99 for general Code penalty if no specific penalty is provided.)
CHAPTER 1474
Satellite Signal Receiving Stations
1474.01   Short title.
1474.02   Permitted use.
1474.03   Limitation on linkage to receivers.
1474.04   Location of stations.
1474.05   Height and diameter.
1474.06   Permit required; fee.
1474.07   Variances.
 
1474.99   Penalty.
   CROSS REFERENCES
   Theft of cable television - see GEN. OFF.
662.09
   Cable television generally - see B.R. & T.
Ch. 816
1474.01 SHORT TITLE.
   This chapter shall be known and cited as the "City of Davison Satellite Dish
Signal Receiving Stations Ordinance."
(Ord. 85-1. Passed 4-22-85.)
1474.02 PERMITTED USE.
   Dish-type satellite signal receiving stations (hereinafter called
"stations"), subject to the regulations set forth in this chapter, may be
located within the City.
(Ord. 85-1. Passed 4-22-85.)
1474.03 LIMITATION ON LINKAGE TO RECEIVERS.
   Stations shall not be linked to receivers which are not located on the same
lot as the station, except when such other lot has common ownership with the
receiver and not more than one household is to be served by such station.
(Ord. 85-1. Passed 4-22-85.)
1474.04 LOCATION OF STATIONS.
   Stations shall be located in a rear yard, as defined by City ordinances, and
behind the principal dwelling or structure located on the lot, if there is one.
Stations shall be located so that however turned or otherwise used, all parts
of the station will be set back at least to the minimum requirements of the
Zoning Code.
(Ord. 85-1. Passed 4-22-85.)
1474.05 HEIGHT AND DIAMETER.
   The height of a station, should the dish antenna be turned perpendicular to
the ground, shall not extend above fifteen feet. The diameter of any dish
antenna shall not exceed twelve feet.
(Ord. 85-1. Passed 4-22-85.)
1474.06 PERMIT REQUIRED; FEE.
   No installation or erection of a station shall be made without a permit
therefor issued by the Building Official and without a fee paid to the Building
Official for such installation. Such fee shall be as set forth in the City's
user fee schedule, as amended from time to time by resolution of Council.
(Ord. 85-1. Passed 4-22-85; Ord. 95-5. Passed 7-10-95.)
1474.07   VARIANCES.
   The Board of Zoning Appeals may grant variances from the provisions of this
chapter when, in its judgment, the enforcement of this chapter will result in
practical difficulties and unnecessary hardships on persons affected hereby. A
hearing shall be held pursuant to the procedures set forth in Section
1262.09 of the Zoning Code.
(Ord. 85-1. Passed 4-22-85.)
1474.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
202.99 for general Code penalty if no specific penalty is provided.)
CHAPTER 1476
Smoke Detectors
1476.01   Short title.
1476.02   Standards for detectors; installation.
1476.03   Dwelling unit defined.
1476.04   Periods of compliance.
1476.05   Sale, transfer or repair of dwellings.
1476.06   Responsibility of Building Official.
1476.07   Rule of construction. (Repealed)
 
1476.99   Penalty.
   CROSS REFERENCES
   Fire alarms - see F.P.
1610.04(BOCA § F-707.0)
   Fire protection systems and equipment - see F.P.
1610.04(BOCA §§ F-500.1 et seq.)
   Smoke detectors - see F.P.
1610.04(BOCA § F-518.0)
1476.01 SHORT TITLE.
   This chapter shall be known and cited as the "City of Davison Smoke Alarm
Ordinance."
(Ord. 82-4. Passed 2-8-82.)
1476.02 STANDARDS FOR DETECTORS; INSTALLATION.
   Each dwelling unit shall be provided with a minimum of one smoke detector
capable of sensing visible or invisible products of combustion. The type of
smoke alarm, device or system installed shall comply with the specifications of
Underwriters' Laboratories, Inc., or any other nationally recognized laboratory
standards, and bear a label indicating that the detector has been so listed and
approved. Such an alarm, device or system, when actuated, shall provide an
alarm suitable to warn the occupants within the individual dwelling unit.
   The installation and maintenance of such alarm, device or system shall be in
accordance with the requirements of the BOCA National Building Code, as adopted
in
Chapter 1420, except where otherwise superseded by this chapter.
   A minimum of one smoke detector shall be located in the immediate area of
all sleeping quarters.
(Ord. 82-4. Passed 2-8-82.)
1476.03 DWELLING UNIT DEFINED.
   A "dwelling unit," for the purpose of this chapter, means a building or
portion thereof, with or without cooking facilities, designed for occupancy by
one or more persons, whether permanent or temporary, for residential purposes,
including, but not limited to, rooming houses, apartments, mobile homes,
convalescent or nursing homes, motel or hotel rooms, single-family residences
and multifamily residences.
(Ord. 82-4. Passed 2-8-82.)
1476.04 PERIODS OF COMPLIANCE.
   All existing multifamily dwelling units shall be in compliance with the
requirements of this chapter within six months from the effective date of this
chapter (Ordinance 82-4, passed February 8, 1982). All existing single-family
dwelling units shall be in compliance with the requirements of this chapter
within one year from the effective date of this chapter.
(Ord. 82-4. Passed 2-8-82.)
1476.05 SALE, TRANSFER OR REPAIR OF DWELLINGS.
   Notwithstanding the provisions of Section
1476.04, no person shall sell, transfer, lease, rent or act as a broker for the
sale or transfer, or landlord for the lease or rental, of a dwelling unit, or
occupy or allow the dwelling unit to be occupied after the sale, transfer,
lease or rental thereof, or where any structural change or repair of a value in
excess of three thousand dollars ($3,000) has been made to the dwelling unit,
unless the dwelling unit meets the requirements of Section
1476.02.
(Ord. 82-4. Passed 2-8-82.)
1476.06 RESPONSIBILITY OF BUILDING OFFICIAL.
   The Building Official or his or her designee shall establish a program to
assure Council that this chapter is being complied with, relative to the
installation, maintenance and operation of smoke detectors.
(Ord. 82-4. Passed 2-8-82.)
1476.07 RULE OF CONSTRUCTION [REPEALED].
1476.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
202.99 for general Code penalty if no specific penalty is provided.)

1480.01 MOST RECENT EDITION ADOPTED.
   Pursuant to Section
10.3 of the City Charter and M.C.L. 117.3(k), that certain document marked and
designated as The International Property Maintenance Code, most recently
adopted edition, as published by the International Code Council, is hereby
adopted as the Housing/Property Maintenance Code of the City, and each and all
of the provisions of such Code are hereby referred to, adopted and made a part
hereof as if fully set out in this chapter, save and except such provisions as
may be hereinafter amended or deleted.
(Ord. 96-004. Passed 2-26-96; Ord. 2008-02. Passed 3-24-08.)
1480.02 FILE COPIES.
   Printed copies of The International Property Maintenance Code, as adopted in
Section
1480.01, shall be kept in the office of the City Clerk, available for review
and inspection by the public at all times.
(Ord. 96-004. Passed 2-26-96; Ord. 2008-02. Passed 3-24-08.)
1480.03 CONFLICT OF LAWS.
   Where a provision of The International Property Maintenance Code, as adopted
in Section
1480.01, is found to be in conflict with a provision of any zoning, housing,
fire, safety or health law of the City, the County or the State, the provision
which establishes the higher standard or assumes the higher jurisdiction for
the promotion and protection of the health, safety and welfare of the City
shall prevail.
(Ord. 96-004. Passed 2-26-96; Ord. 2008-02. Passed 3-24-08.)
1480.04 AMENDMENTS.
   The International Property Maintenance Code, as adopted in Section
1480.01, is hereby amended as follows:
   Section 101.1. The City of Davison.
   Section 101.3. Substitute Michigan Rehabilitation Code for Existing
Buildings for International Existing Building Code.
   Section 102.3. Substitute Michigan Rehabilitation Code for Existing
Buildings for International Existing Building Code. Substitute City of Davison
Zoning Ordinance for International Zoning Code.
   Section 103.5. Fees, if any, shall be in accordance with a resolution or
resolutions which may, from time to time, be adopted by the Davison City
Council.
   Section 107.2(5). For violations of Sections 108, 109 or 110, inform the
property owner of the right to appeal.
   Section 201.3. Terms defined in other codes. Where terms are not defined in
this Code and are defined in the Michigan Residential Code, International Fire
code, City of Davison Zoning Ordinance, Michigan Plumbing Code, Michigan
Mechanical Code, Michigan Building Code, Michigan Rehabilitation Code for
Existing Buildings and the Michigan Electrical Code, such terms shall have the
meaning ascribed to them as in those codes.
   Section 401.3 and 702.3. Substitute Michigan Building Code for International
Building Code.
(Ord. 96-004. Passed 2-26-96; Ord. 2008-02. Passed 3-24-08.)
1480.05 DEFINITIONS.
   Wherever the term "building official," "administrative authority" or "code
official" appears in The International Property Maintenance Code, as adopted in
Section
1480.01, it shall be deemed to mean the Building Official of the City or his or
her duly authorized agent. Wherever the term "Municipality," "City" or "local
jurisdiction" appears in such Code, it shall be deemed to mean the City of
Davison. Wherever the term "Board of Appeals" appears in such Code, it shall be
deemed to mean the Zoning Board of Appeals of the City of Davison.
(Ord. 96-004. Passed 2-26-96; Ord. 2008-02. Passed 3-24-08.)
1480.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
202.99 for general Code penalty if no specific penalty is provided.)

1610.01 INTERNATIONAL FIRE CODE ADOPTED.
   Pursuant to Section 10.3 of the City Charter and MCL 117.3(k), as amended,
the City adopts by reference the International Fire Code throughout its
corporate limits. The International Fire Code to be enforced pursuant hereto
shall be that most recently adopted by the International Code Council.
(Ord. 92-2. Passed 2-10-92; Ord. 2024-06. Passed - - .)
1610.02 FILE AND DISTRIBUTION COPIES.
   Printed copies of the International Fire Code, as adopted in Section
1610.01 , shall be kept in the office of the City Clerk, available for
inspection by, and distribution to, the public at all times.
(Ord. 92-2. Passed 2-10-92; Ord. 2024-06. Passed - - .)
1610.03 CONFLICT OF LAWS.
   In the event of a conflict or inconsistency between any of the provisions of
the International Fire Code, as adopted in Section
1610.01 , and a provision of any local ordinance, resolution, rule or
regulation, the local ordinance, resolution, rule or regulation shall control.
In the event of a conflict or inconsistency between any of the provisions of
the International Fire Code, as aforesaid, and a provision of state law or
regulation, the provision of state law or regulation shall control. In the
event of a conflict or inconsistency between any of the provisions of the
International Fire Code, as aforesaid, and a provision of any other technical
code adopted by reference by the City, the higher or stricter standard shall
control.
(Ord. 2024-06. Passed - - .)
1610.04 AMENDMENTS. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Section
1610.04 was repealed by Ordinance 2024-06.)
1610.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
202.99 for general Code penalty if no specific penalty is provided.)
CHAPTER 1620
Open Burning
1620.01   Open fire defined.
1620.02   Burning of waste material prohibited; exceptions.
1620.03   Other open fires; permit required.
1620.04   Proximity of fires to buildings.
1620.05   Fires in streets and public places.
1620.06   Danger of spreading.
1620.07   Attendance at fires.
1620.08   Fires at night.
1620.09   Emergency conditions.
1620.10   Violations.
 
1620.99   Penalty.
   CROSS REFERENCES
   Fires in parks - see S.U. & P.S.
1062.06(c)
   Control of smoke - see P. & Z. 1283.12
   Fire protection equipment - see F.P.
1610.04
(BOCA §§ F-101.6, F-500.1 et seq.)
1620.01 OPEN FIRE DEFINED.
   As used in this chapter, "open fire" means any fire upon any woodland, lot,
subdivision, grass land, field or public right of way within the City not
wholly contained within an incinerator, outside fireplace, grill or other
receptacle constructed for and suitable to the purpose of burning combustibles.
1620.02 BURNING OF WASTE MATERIAL PROHIBITED; EXCEPTIONS.
   No person shall start, cause or permit to be started any open fire for the
purpose of burning waste material within the City. However, the City Manager or
his or her designated representative shall have the right to authorize the open
burning of waste matter, upon application to such City Manager or
representative, if such City Manager or representative determines that such
burning will provide for the general welfare of the community, except that in
any event the City Manager or his or her designated representative shall not
have the right to authorize the open burning of automobiles, or any part
thereof, or toxic or explosive materials.
(Ord. 73-6. Passed 8-27-73.)
1620.03 OTHER OPEN FIRES; PERMIT REQUIRED.
   No person shall start or have any open fire, apart from fires regulated by
Section
1620.01, without first obtaining a permit therefor from the City Manager or his
or her designated representative. Such permit shall state the address where
such fire is to be started, the owner of the property involved, the type of
material to be burned, the quantity of material to be burned, the estimated
burning time, the person starting the fire and the person responsible for
attending such fire. There will be no charge for such permit.
(Ord. 73-6. Passed 8-27-73.)
1620.04 PROXIMITY OF FIRES TO BUILDINGS.
   No person shall start or have any open fire or any other fire, including any
form of combustible fuel-type cooking fire, whether contained or not, within
ten feet of any residence, building or other structure.
(Ord. 85-9. Passed 8-26-85.)
1620.05 FIRES IN STREETS AND PUBLIC PLACES.
   No person shall start or have any open fire or any other fire, including
charcoal-type cooking fires, on any sidewalk, parkway, street, highway, alley,
park or other public way or place except in containers provided by the City for
such purposes.
1620.06 DANGER OF SPREADING.
   No person shall start or have any fire upon any woodland, lot, subdivision,
grassland, field or public right of way within the City whenever there is
danger of such fire spreading beyond the control of the person starting or
having such open fire so as to injure, damage or endanger the life, limb or
property of another.
1620.07 ATTENDANCE AT FIRES.
   No person who starts or has any fire upon any woodland, lot, subdivision,
grassland, field or public right of way within the City shall leave such open
fire unattended by a person of mature years until such fire has been completely
extinguished.
1620.08 FIRES AT NIGHT.
   No person shall start or have any open fire upon any woodland, lot,
subdivision, grassland, field or public right of way within the City before
sunrise or later than one-half hour following sunset.
1620.09 EMERGENCY CONDITIONS.
   The City Manager or his or her designated representative is hereby
authorized and directed to declare when a state of emergency exists with
respect to fires within the City, and the City Manager or his or her authorized
representative shall have the authority during such state of emergency to
prohibit all out-of-doors burning of combustibles within the City. The state of
emergency shall exist when the City Manager or his or her authorized
representative makes a formal declaration of the existence of such a state of
emergency and when notices to that effect are posted by the City Manager or his
or her authorized representative in two public places within the City, one of
which shall be the City Hall, and when a copy of the formal declaration is
delivered to the City Clerk. A like procedure shall be employed when the state
of emergency ceases to exist. The requirement of this section as to posting
notices can be met by publication of the notice in a newspaper of general local
circulation.
1620.10 VIOLATIONS.
   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be punished as
prescribed in Section
202.99. However, the Court may, at its discretion, suspend any sentence imposed
under Section
202.99 and grant probation to any person convicted and the court may, further,
at its discretion, condition such probation and/or suspension of sentence upon
reimbursement to the City of any expense incurred by the City in extinguishing
or attempting to extinguish any fire made in violation of any of the provisions
of this chapter and/or upon satisfactory repair or replacement of any damaged
property, public or private.
1620.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
202.99 for general Code penalty if no specific penalty is provided.)
CHAPTER 1621
Outdoor Solid Fuel Heating Devices
1621.01   Use prohibited.
1621.02   Definition.
1621.01 USE PROHIBITED.
   Outdoor solid fuel heating devices are prohibited and shall not be installed
or operated within the City.
(Ord. 2008-05. Passed 7-14-08.)
1621.02 DEFINITION.
   An “outdoor solid fuel heating device” is a device, structure, or apparatus
that is located outside, which supplies direct or indirect heat from the
burning of solid fuel, including but not limited to wood, to a building.
(Ord. 2008-05. Passed 7-14-08.)
